SENT.plain: Sixteen patients with a clinical diagnosis of subcortical arteriosclerotic encephalopathy (Binswanger's disease) were studied
Mild or moderate dementia was found in 14 cases, with characteristic disturbances of concentration, and psychic retardation with apathy
Neuropsychological studies revealed that signs of diffuse lesions in the frontal lobes dominated
Impairment of memory was significant in all cases
Although intellectual impairment in subcortical arteriosclerotic encephalopathy resembled subcortical dementia, some significant differences were found
